section.title: Restore your data

warning.para: OmegaT is a robust and trustworthy application, but even so, it is smart take precautions to guard against data loss when using it, just as with any other application.

section.para: When you translate the documents in a project, OmegaT stores all your progress in the , file located in the project’s folder. That file is in fact a translation memory and is automatically saved at regular intervals. You can also use discretionally to make sure that your valuable work is saved.
Beside of that, OmegaT also backs-up that file, by automatically creating a sequential number of copies (up to ten), marked with a timestamp, every time you open or reload your project.

These backup filenames’ follow the pattern project_save.tmx.YYYYMMDDhhmm.bak where the final part is the time stamp indicating when the file was created: YYYY represents the 4-digit year, MM the month, DD the day of the month, and hh and mm indicate the hours and minutes.

The file project_save.tmx always contains the most recent data, which is a copy of project_save.tmx created when the project was opened. Then come the incremental backup files that are created as your translation progresses. project_save.tmx is always the file with the most recent data.
If you believe that you have lost translation data, follow the steps below to restore the project to the most recent backup memory, which is usually less than ten minutes old or so.

listitem.para: Rename the current project_save.tmx file (to project_save.tmx.tmp, for example).
Select the backup translation memory most likely to contain the data you are looking for.
Make regular copies of the file /omegat/project_save.tmx to a backup media, such as a USB key or an external hard drive, or to a cloud service.
While you are still familiarizing yourself with OmegaT, create translated files at regular intervals to make sure they contain the latest version of your translation.

Be very cautious about making changes to the files in the source folder, to the segmentation rules, or to the file filters, partway through a project. Modifying either after you have started your translation could result in OmegaT becoming unable to find a segment that you have already translated.

Consult the and other sections of this manual to get started. Should you run into problems, post a message in the OmegaT user group. Do not hesitate to post in the language you are most comfortable using.
